org.dockbox.selene.common.tasks.pipeline.pipelines

Class ConvertiblePipeline<P,I>

  • java.lang.Object

    public class ConvertiblePipeline<P,I>
extends AbstractPipeline<P,I>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected ConvertiblePipeline(java.lang.Class<I> inputClass)
      A private constructor for the pipeline as all convertible pipelines should be instantiated initally as ConvertiblePipelineSource

      • process

        protected Exceptional<I> process(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull Exceptional<I> exceptionalInput)
        Processes an input by calling AbstractPipeline.processPipe(IPipe, Exceptional) on each IPipe in the pipeline and then returns the output wrapped in an Exceptional.

        Parameters:
        exceptionalInput - A non-null Exceptional which contains the input value and throwable
        Returns:

      • setCancelBehaviour

        public ConvertiblePipeline<P,I> setCancelBehaviour(CancelBehaviour cancelBehaviour)
        Sets the cancel behaviour to be used by the entire pipeline by internally calling setCancelBehaviour(CancelBehaviour, PipelineDirection).
        Overrides:

        Parameters:
        cancelBehaviour - A CancelBehaviour describing the cancellability of the pipeline
        Returns:
        Itself

      • process

        public Exceptional<I> process(@NotNull
                              P input,
                              @Nullable
                              @Nullable java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Processes an input by recursively calling the process method of the previous pipeline. This will eventually call the ConvertiblePipelineSource.process(Object, Throwable), which will stop the recursive calling of previous pipelines. If somehow, a convertible pipeline is used as the source of the pipeline, then it will attempt to cast the P input to I.
        Specified by:
        process in class AbstractPipeline<P,I>
        Parameters:
        input - The non-null input value
        throwable - The nullable input Throwable
        Returns:
        An Exceptional containing the I output. If the output is not present it will contain a throwable describing why

      • cancelPipeline

        public void cancelPipeline()
        Cancels the pipeline and all the following pipelines.
        Overrides:
        cancelPipeline in class AbstractPipeline<P,I>

      • size

        public int size()
        Calculates the size of the pipeline by recursively getting the size of the previous pipeline. Note: The size includes the number of converters in the pipeline too.
        Overrides:
        size in class AbstractPipeline<P,I>
        Returns:
        The number of IPipe and converters in the pipeline

      • processConverted

        protected <K> Exceptional<K> processConverted(@NotNull
                                              P input,
                                              @Nullable
                                              @Nullable java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Takes an input and internally processes it by calling process(Object, Throwable) and then converting the output using the converter provided in convertPipeline(Function, Class).
        Type Parameters:
        K - The type of the next pipeline
        Parameters:
        input - The non-null P input to be processed by the pipeline
        throwable - An nullable Throwable that may have been thrown while processing the input
        Returns:
        An Exceptional of type K containing the converted output

      • convertPipeline

        public <K> ConvertiblePipeline<P,K> convertPipeline(@NotNull
                                                    @NotNull java.util.function.Function<? super I,K> converter,
                                                    @NotNull
                                                    @NotNull java.lang.Class<K> outputClass)
        Converts the pipeline to a different type. Note: When you convert a pipeline, this automatically makes it uncancellable and so will throw an IllegalPipelineException if you try and process an input with any CancellablePipes in this pipeline.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The type of the new pipeline
        Parameters:
        converter - A non-null Function that takes in an I input and returns a converted K output
        outputClass - A non-null Class of the type of the new pipeline
        Returns:
        A pipeline of the new type

      • removePipeline

        public <K> ConvertiblePipeline<P,K> removePipeline(java.lang.Class<K> previousClass)
        Removes the current pipeline by clearing the IPipes and any links with previous and next pipelines.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The type of the previous pipeline's input
        Parameters:
        previousClass - The Class of the previous pipeline's input
        Returns:
        The previous pipeline. If there are no previous pipelines, then it returns itself

protected @Nullable ConvertiblePipeline<P,?> getPreviousPipeline()

        protected void setCancelBehaviour(CancelBehaviour cancelBehaviour,
                                  PipelineDirection direction)
        Propagates the cancel behaviour throughout all the linked pipelines in a particular PipelineDirection.
        Parameters:
        cancelBehaviour - The CancelBehaviour to be used by the pipeline
        direction - The PipelineDirection that the cancel behaviour needs to be passed along
